issue.title: Sporadic move_base failure in CloudSim: "Unable to get starting pose of robot, unable to create global plan"

content.raw:
@{557058:e6cc7c7b-9d1b-4abe-87d5-5f0da7c863e1} The reason why I quoted the late time is because when this happens the text logs get totally filled up with this error message and I lose all the earlier logs. I believe the scoring stops after 60 minutes but the simulation may keep on going for longer - with the urban practice scenarios I think it was about 2 hours or so. I know the issue isn’t just because of the late time though because in these cases the robots have serious behavior issues, often just spinning around in circles or they are completely stopped for the entire simulation, unable to even get to the entrance. 

If I can continue to reproduce this issue, I’m trying to collect some data now to see if topics such as`/clock` are received correctly or are missing a lot of data - that might help to see if it is related to issue #261 .
content.html:
@Steven Gray The reason why I quoted the late time is because when this happens the text logs get totally filled up with this error message and I lose all the earlier logs. I believe the scoring stops after 60 minutes but the simulation may keep on going for longer - with the urban practice scenarios I think it was about 2 hours or so. I know the issue isn’t just because of the late time though because in these cases the robots have serious behavior issues, often just spinning around in circles or they are completely stopped for the entire simulation, unable to even get to the entrance.

If I can continue to reproduce this issue, I’m trying to collect some data now to see if topics such as/clock are received correctly or are missing a lot of data - that might help to see if it is related to issue #261 .
